intro: Terminalia dhofarica, commonly known as the Socotra cypress, is a unique and rare tree native to the Socotra archipelago. It is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-shaped crown and scale-like leaves that are adapted to the arid environment. The plant belongs to the family Combretaceae and is known for its slow growth and longevity. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against harsh weather conditions. Terminalia dhofarica plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a symbol of the unique biodiversity of Socotra.
